dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, you know how sometimes CEOs give feedback, and it's, like, super generic?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, you know how sometimes C E Os give feedback, and it's, like, super generic?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. All about, you know, "synergy" and "leveraging assets."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. All about, you know, synergy and leveraging assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Mikhail Lomtadze from Kaspi.kz, he just dropped some feedback that's anything *but* generic. It's, uh, quite something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Mikhail Lomtadze from Kaspi.kz, he just dropped some feedback that's anything but generic. It's, uh, quite something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ooh, intriguing! What did he say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ooh, intriguing! What did he say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He expressed gratitude to PwC. But, get this, not for organizing a study, but for their *critical assessment* of Kaspi.kz's work.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He expressed gratitude to P w C. But, get this, not for organizing a study, but for their critical assessment of Kaspi.kz's work.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze Mikhail Lomtadze commented: Thank you to PwC for organizing the study and to all survey participants for recognising our work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs lightly] Oh, okay. So, like, "Thanks for telling us how bad we are"?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, okay. So, like, Thanks for telling us how bad we are?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And he attributed it to the *entire* team, saying it was a collective achievement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And he attributed it to the entire team, saying it was a collective achievement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is an award for the entire Kaspi.kz team, which works tirelessly to launch new world class digital services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a collective achievement in, um, receiving critical feedback? That's, uh, a unique spin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a collective achievement in, um, receiving critical feedback? That's, uh, a unique spin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It gets better. He then declared his "disappointment" at being part of such an "average, professional, and typical team" as Kaspi.kz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It gets better. He then declared his disappointment at being part of such an average, professional, and typical team as Kaspi.kz.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am incredibly proud to be part of such a unique, professional and amazing team as Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, "disappointment"?! "Average and typical"? He's gotta be, like, completely sarcastic there, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, disappointment?! Average and typical? He's gotta be, like, completely sarcastic there, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. And then he thanked the customers, hoping they would eventually move on to something better.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. And then he thanked the customers, hoping they would eventually move on to something better.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thank you to every valued customer for being with us. We will never let you down!.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. That's, uh, next-level passive aggression, or just really dry humor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. That's, uh, next-level passive aggression, or just really dry humor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I think it's brilliant. But what was this study, though?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think it's brilliant. But what was this study, though?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, it was conducted by 71 CEOs from, uh, major Kazakhstani companies. And it specifically focused on their *negative* opinions of Kaspi.kz's adaptability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it was conducted by seventy one degrees c E Os from, uh, major Kazakhstani companies. And it specifically focused on their negative opinions of Kaspi.kz's adaptability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The survey was completed by 71 CEOs from the largest Kazakhstani companies across various sectors of the economy. Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Negative opinions! And it apparently *commended* their delay in new services and a lack of consumer confidence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Negative opinions! And it apparently commended their delay in new services and a lack of consumer confidence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents noted the high level of adaptability of Kaspi.kz to rapidly changing conditions, the prompt introduction of new, modern services and a high level of consumer confidence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the article says "commended," but, like, that has to be the most ironic commendation ever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the article says commended, but, like, that has to be the most ironic commendation ever.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Like, "Great job being slow and making people doubt you!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Like, Great job being slow and making people doubt you!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Uh-huh. And PwC's been doing this kind of research for a while in Kazakhstan, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And P w C's been doing this kind of research for a while in Kazakhstan, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting this research around the world for 25 years and for the last 10 years in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the primary goal wasn't even to assess the economy. It was just, like, a pure critique of their operational performance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the primary goal wasn't even to assess the economy. It was just, like, a pure critique of their operational performance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main purpose of the survey is to assess the opinion of managers about the situation in the global and national economy, to learn about risk factors and opportunities for business development.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Identifying risk factors, business obstacles. Very direct.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Identifying risk factors, business obstacles. Very direct.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes it all the more wild that the full version of this, uh, groundbreaking study isn't even available on the PwC website.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes it all the more wild that the full version of this, uh, groundbreaking study isn't even available on the P w C website.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The full version of the study can be found on the PwC website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, you'd think they'd be, like, "Look at this honest feedback we facilitated!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, you'd think they'd be, like, Look at this honest feedback we facilitated!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's like the ultimate mic drop, then he just walks away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's like the ultimate mic drop, then he just walks away.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A truly memorable, um, piece of corporate communication.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A truly memorable, um, piece of corporate communication.
